pr_title: feat(core): filter developer menu logs by log level

timeline.message: filter dev menu logs by log level

timeline.bodyText: This is a perfect place to use a Switch statement instead of the if else chain.
timeline.author: TrekSoft

replies.bodyText: Also, I wonder if there's a way you can simply include the LogLevel value in each MenuItem.
replies.author: TrekSoft

replies.bodyText: I did try to use a Switch statement instead of all the if else's, but resource IDs cannot be used in switch statements.
replies.author: eeatonaws

timeline.bodyText: What's the purpose for setting the placeholder text first before setting it to getFilteredLogs?
timeline.author: TrekSoft

replies.bodyText: In a previous PR Jameson commented that it would be helpful to display some placeholder text (i.e. "Search results will appear here...") in case it takes time to display the logs (#659 (comment)), although that comment was more related to when you initially navigate to the logs view. If it does take time to display the logs, I thought it could be helpful to display the placeholder text indicating that search results are being retrieved, otherwise it may seem like the search functionality is broken.
replies.author: eeatonaws

timeline.message: use menu item title to retrieve log level
